title: ITS A PART OF AGRA FORT
review: its 1 agra fort part , you must visit with a guide as without guide you never know what is real reason of everything

title: Must visit in Agra fort
review: Just after entry from one of the gate- Singh gate, you can see this. In front of the Diwane-i- Aam, it has one TOP and enter inside and just go upstair and see the most amazing structure of Agra fort

title: An arcaded hall within the Agra Fort exudes an air of calm
review: Diwan-i-Aam can be found in the grounds of the vast Agra fort.It's worth spending some time here and looking at the alcoves of inlaid marble which provides the setting for the Peacock Throne.

title: Beautiful Hall
review: The Dian-i-Am in Agra fort is superb architecture with fantastic arches and alcoves with beautiful inlaid work in a variety of semi precious stones. It is a huge building where the king met his subjects if they had a greavance. See the place of The Chain! Surrounded by lawn on which are birds- hoopoes galore. A quiet peacful place after the busy Taj Mahal.

title: Great...
review: It is a wonderful place to see great mugal architecture work. It is inside the agra fort.  It is well designed hall where king used to interact with the common public.

title: A standout building
review: Agra Fort is impressive, but this is one of the more impressive structures in the compound, enhanced by the huge gardens outside.

title: A fine building within the fort
review: One of several beautiful structures within the Agra Fort. Very harmonious architecture. Many fine details to be admired.

title: majestic
review: Beautiful architecture, makes us proud of our heritage

title: Awesome natural gardens and architecture...
review: This is a must visit site in the Agra fort... It has historic significance apart from the nice piece of architectural marvel... highly recommended

title: Agra Fort - Hall of Public Audience
review: This is one of the first parts of the Agra Fort that you get to see on your tour - and it is one of the most impressive. Great architecture with amazing detail!

title: Be a Diwan at Diwan-i-am
review: This is part of Agra fort.A historical place which was a place where citizen can meet the ruler to explain their problems. It is so built that the pillars will not obstruct the view of the  people anywhere they sit. An amazing technology and engineering marvel.

title: Another reason to visit Agra Fort
review: This is another beautiful structure used by the rulers of the past to hold audience. The architecture is outstanding.

title: This place is in Agra Fort..
review: as soon as you enter Agra fort, you move into diwan-i-aam. this courtyard used to host meetings with the king and the common subjects.

title: This is good place
review: This is one of the good place for the normal people during the Mugal kingdom where they can come with their issues to get solution from king.

title: Nice!
review: we visited this place as part of our tour when we went to see Agra Fort. It is a nice place and we also took some photos.

title: Great architecture
review: Lovely to see the mogul architecture, and immense detail all around.  I have been told you can’t count all the pillars in one go, but didn’t try to find out.

title: Enjoyed the visit
review: Similar to some of the other Forts but with better kept grounds.  You need to have a guide to understand the history otherwise a lot would be lost and you might find yourself just wandering around.

title: The place where Emprer met the common Citizens
review: An architectural marvel , you have to see very intently to appreciate it . You will admire the beauty and intricacy of carvings in stone .

title: Mughal architecture
review: This building is within the Fort. Its function was as a place where the ordinary citizens could meet the Mughal Emperor to discuss problems or matters of concern. The whole fort and gardens are beautiful and particularly well maintained.

title: fabulous
review: fabulous place to visit. so much to see and the buildings are stunning. Well worth a visit. can get some great pictures

title: Kings court in the fort
review: It’s excellent piece of architecture. It was court of the king open for public. Very well made and maintained. Must see the procedures of the ancient laws. Specially the architecture of this building is unique.

title: nice fort within the Agra Fort
review: It was the place where the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan  and his successors met general public and heard their complaints. The massive hall has a flat roof and is divided into three sections. Two arched red sandstone gateways on the north and south lead to the hall. The building, originally built in red sandstone, is plastered over with white shell paste resembling white marble. Its ceiling and columns were painted with gold.

title: Kings Darbar
review: As the name suggests, this was the the darbar of the king. King used to do his daily court from here.

title: Audience hall of 17th Century
review: It Is a room, where the Mughal emperors and his successors received members of the general public and heard their grievances. It is a Court of Muslim mugal rulers where they listened the matter of public and solve

title: agra fort delight
review: located within the agra fort. called as dewaan a aam or where normal people could go to the king to seek justice. clean and nice. liked the place.

title: Grand Mughal durbar
review: During my vacation in Agra, I had visited the iconic Agra Fort which is a UNESCO World Heritage site and this big hall which was used as the hall of public audience is located inside this fort complex. This hall has a giant throne at a height where the Mughal Emperor used to seat and listen to the problems of the common people. Our guide told us that such is the architecture of this hall that Emperor could see people coming in from all 3 directions into the fort compound. The garden in front of the hall enhances the beauty of this place.

title: Inside the Agra Fort
review: It is part of the tour at the Agra Fort, no additional tickets required. You can relate with the movie Jodha Akhbar where the common people come to request the king to reduce the commissions they pay.

title: Place inside agra fort.
review: It's inside the Agra fort. It was the place of general public gathering. Architecture is of mughal dynasty. Well preserved by ASI.

title: Amazing !!
review: This place is still part of Agra Fort, again i would recommend to have a local tour guide with you since there are so much history in this place.

title: Beautiful architectural symmetry that is a delight to the eye
review: This is one of the many buildings that you can visit within the Agra Fort complex (members of the public only get to visit the 25% of the complex as the rest is a working Indian military base

title: For the Commoners
review: The Diwan-i-Am or the place where the common people gathered, is located within the Agra fort. The sense of place and openness is amazing.

title: Beautiful but ...,,
review: Very beautiful place, but my guide has no idea what he was saying, I recommend try to do home work before you get there or find an expensive tour guide, this place was awesome

title: Nice
review: Just adjacent to the Diwan-e-am, there is a red sand stone building known as Diwan-i-khas. Since this place was much smaller than the court held for private audience. It is here that the Mughal emperor would have private meetings with the visiting dignitaries and guests. It was built in the year 1635 by Shah Jahan.

title: Agra Attraction
review: Diwan-i-Am,which is located inside Red Fort was used by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan for domestic government business, and features a throne room where the emperor listened to petitioners. A large courtyard is there. Good place to take few snaps.

title: Old Fort
review: This visit to Diwan-i-Am is a part of the tour to Agra. We had to walk around a lot but it was quite comfortable.

title: Impressive structure!
review: If you close your eyes, you can imagine what it must have been like more than 500 years ago when court was held here at this beautiful location!

title: Splendor of Mughal Durbar
review: Diwan-i-Am is Mughal version of House of Commons. Here, emperors hold to hold the Royal Court (Durbar) and attend to state matters. Even commoners could approach the emperor for justice over here, hence the name. Awesome architecture with intricate carvings. Garden besides the courtyard enhances the beauty of the place.

title: Great monument in Agra Fort
review: It is an amazing architecture and engineering within the Agra Fort.  Very nice to watch this structure so closely. You will be amazed.

title: One of the highlights of Agra fort
review: This is another typical audience hall in the Mughal emperor palace. This one has a very lovely architecture that seem to be built in 3D given a lovely sense of perspective and magnificence. The construction is such that the only place you can see the whole audience is when seated in the ruler throne

title: again lovely buiding in agra
review: its made with red sand stone and near taj mahal the entrance fee was not so high aroung 7USD but good time see afternoon

title: Takes you back in that era
review: This is the place where the king used to hear his subjects or addressed his subjects, beautifully ornate high place where the king used to sit , this place is overwhelming in its. Vastness

title: Design precision
review: Considering the period this lovely design was built - before modern methods with instruments etc - the exact precision of these columns is telling.

title: Worth a visit
review: This is the original public hall to the fort and it is very well maintained considering its age. Columns have been positioned in such a way that the whole audience can be seen from the rulers throne. It is worth a visit particularly with a guide who can provide more details on its purpose.

title: Great example of Mughal symmetry
review: This is an "audience hall" from the Mughal period. The columns  are in perfect symmetry and align precisely. Step back a little bit when viewing to appreciate the perfection.

title: Lovely building
review: This is one of the superb building located inside Afra fort where we are told the Emperor held his audiences.  Lovel!

title: Well designed complex with great architectural attention
review: Diwan-I-Aam is located inside the Agra fort. This is the place where Emperor used to interact with the common public, listen to their complaints and meet them There are two gates which were used to enter this complex inside the fort. Emperor used to sit on his throne at the center of the this place and address public. the complete architecture of this building is so precise that people can directly see the Emperor without any obstruction, while entering from two gates. This was common peoples can directly see their Emperor and pay their respects while entering. The pillars in the building are designed in such a way that they won't obstruct the public from viewing the Emperor.

title: Inside the fort
review: This is an area where the rulers would sit and effectively hold court. You can roam around the area and the open spaces for the more common people.

title: Lovely
review: Diwan-i-Am is the hall of public audience inside Agra Fort.  It is impressive how sophisticated the design and location of the building was to maximise exposure of the Emperor.

title: Mughals knew how to build stuff!
review: We loved this site and wished we had more time to explore it. One hour is NOT enough. Take your time, there are lots of beautiful nooks and crannies. As with the Taj and other sites in Agra, there is almost NO explanatory info there, so do your homework first, before you go. Or hire an expensive guide (cheap ones won't be helpful).

title: The Public Audience Hall of Agra Fort
review: Mughal architecture at its best. It is not difficult to imagine how the ruler received his subjects and listened to their petitions.

title: Nice architecture
review: Strictly speaking, this is not an attraction in itself. It is one of the 2-3 key places that you visit as part of the Agra Fort.

title: Diwani am Agra fort
review: It's the meeting place where hearing of common people took somnice place inside Agra fort enjoy it and have pix

title: Impressive building
review: This part of the Agra fort with its pillars, ceilings, doors and history about its use and distinctions is impressive.

title: Impressive Structure
review: This building provides a covered open space with beautiful internal multiple arches. This is typically Mughal architecture and the building takes the principal position overlooking the gardens and parade area.

title: Beautiful and elegant building
review: This sits within the walls of the Red Fort in Agra. It is a beautiful building, light and elegant. The Emperor would hear the pleas of his subjects in this space. He, himself, would sit in the 'Royal Box, whilst the petitioners would stand on a marble dais below. The box is delightfully decorated with inlay work.

title: Use a guide
review: You miss so much if you don't get a local guide.  We really got a sense of its history and majesty of that time

title: A part of Agra Fort
review: The area the king would speak to the public. A courtyard made of pillars. A part of the Agra Fort...

title: part of the fort
review: if you wander around the fort in an anti clockwise manner then you come to this via a very non descript set of stairs and it's something of a shock to walk out on to this massive 'space'.

title: Wobderful
review: This is place built inside the Agra Fort. Will be astonished to see the marble carved designs which includes coloured marbles and the petal works.

title: Kya Baat He
review: Fort is Wonderful and inside various places also gr8 to see, However Local Crowd of guide is worst not to hire any one....

title: Really Enjoyed
review: Very interesting, would liked to have had more time but we were on a tour. Not as busy as some of the other places we visited.

title: Very Nice
review: Very nice and pity not to visit when you’re already in Agra, but if you don’t have enough time in my opinion Amber Fort in Jaipur is much nicer

title: Amazing audience hall within Agra Fort
review: There are several ways to enter this area when visiting and touring the Agra Fort. We entered from the side and saw the beautiful lawn/garden  and walls that encompass the Diwan-I-Am. When we approached the audience hall the magnificent off-white arches and pillars and elevated platform was quite picturesque. There is a large paved courtyard in front of hall with a 'out of place' grave, none the less this is a great place to see.

title: Part of fort
review: It is a place where general people us to come and ask for help from the emperor. It kept clean and still very calm

title: A photography unit...
review: For people looking to make a picture of a unit in a grand monument this is the place.

title: For the common man
review: This is part of the Agra Fort with a Durbar hall created by Akbar where he can meet common man. It is a simple looking hall, which is spacious. The word is that, this hall is used for his courtiers and the vast open space is for common man to sit as audience in the court of Akbar. The day we went was cool and pleasant and hence it was an enjoyable experience of Mughal architecture.

title: Interesting
review: Went with our family and little granddaughters. Quite interesting not too crowded , not fascinating to small children

title: Beautiful view
review: We were here during our Agra tour. The place was a nice stopover with a fantastic view of Yamuna river.

title: The Hall of Public Audience
review: This grand hall was another of the grand designs of Shah Jahan. This massive hall made of marble with rows of ornate pillors was where the emperor would address the general public as well as nobility. While the marble construction is very impressive, the stage which the emperor occupied while addressing his audience was even more ornate with very detailed designs which were the trademark of Shah Jahan.

title: Located within Fort
review: Located within fort. It was used by the kings to conduct meetings with the general public. Olden day townhalls!

title: Impressive building
review: Monday 12th February and we visited the amazing Fort in Agra. One of the outstanding buildings within the Fort is this building Diwan i Am, hall of public meeting.

title: Marvelous Architecture
review: Must visit to see Light & Sound show in the evening.

title: Hall for public
review: This is inside the agra fort. It was built for the public and the mughal emperor meeting. The emperor used to hear the public here.

title: Fascinating architecture - a must see.
review: This is a wonderful site with some exquisite architecture and fantastic carving. The portion of the site that is open to visitors is generally well presented with information boards and pleasant landscaping.

title: A very nice place to visit.
review: I would suggest to get a good tour guide and will make you understand much better. Our guide was very humble and had a good knowledge

title: Very large
review: Interesting site to visit.  A guide is very helpful.  Plenty of photo opportunities.  Well maintained exhibit.

title: Place for Common People
review: You can get the view of Diwan-i-am just after entering into the fort. The place where emperor use to meet common people. Open from 3 sides with lot of pillars.

title: For Common Man
review: It is also a part of Agra Fort. Just after entering into the fort, it is the first thing that appear with lot of pillars. Emperor use to sit above people to listen to their problems here.

title: Very Good Part of Agra Fort
review: This shows where the Mughal kings greeted their subjects and is a nice looking space within Agra Fort. The ceilings and decorations are nice and once again shows the fabulous proportions of these historic buildings

title: Beautiful Courtyard within the the Fort Complex!
review: This is a courtyard built by mughals to address the common public, lies within the Agra Fort complex. A must visit site.

title: The People's Court--treat to the eye
review: This fabulous piece of architecture inside the Agra Fort was the People's Court where the kings met with his subjects. It is a visual treat and amazing to photograph from all angles.  Take some time to wander around this place and soak in its history. You could also rest a while in and around it sitting in its shade and admiring the beauty. Dream up how this place must have buzzed with people coming here from far and near to meet with their emperor.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: This stunning part of the fort is the area where the common man use to be allowed into. Definitely recommend a guide or audio guide to be able to appreciate the history of this area of the fort. Architecture of this part of the fort was one of my favourite!

title: Nice Fort!!!
review: Diwan Fort is situated in Agra. Photography view was beautiful and excellent. Architecture was too good.

title: within the ambit of Agra Fort
review: It is  located inside the Agra Fort, the guide will explain  all the details, this is one the place where pilgrims will see and enjoy this place.

title: House of Commoners
review: As in all the Mughal palaces. Diwan - i- Amm is the place where the king used to meet his citizens or the common man.

title: Court Room for Commons
review: Nice building, a place for the common man court issues. Nicely explained by the guide. Aam means the common.

title: The royal court for the public
review: You do not have a choice but to imagine the mesmerising architecture and grandeur of the Mughal era. Best part is the architecture where in despite so many pillars in the area, you can look directly at the royal section where the emporerors used to sit for court proceedings.

title: Fabulous views of Taj Mahal
review: Obviously most people associate Agra with the Taj Mahal but the Agra Fort is also very impressive. There are fabulous views looking toward the Taj Mahal from here, although best seen in the afternoon as the sky is often hazy in the morning. This is the same view as seen by the Mughal emperor who built the Taj Mahal when he was placed under house arrest by his son on seizing power.

title: Historic monument inside Agra Fort
review: Diwan I Am is a majestic pilloried massive structure inside agra fort. This structure which looks even now solid has witnesses several historic proclamations and durbars during Moghul rule.

title: Common people Arena
review: This place lies within Agra Fort. The fascinating thing for this place is its pillars. One can take good snaps inside this place. As the name suggest the place is for common people, you will not find enough finishing in this place. Please do a guide and he will give complete insight about the Place.

title: Diwan-i-Am @ Agra Fort - Hall of Public Audience: A Space for Commoners
review: Diwan-I-Am or Hall of Public Audience was the place where the emperor addressed the general public as well as the nobility. It also played a part in the celebration religious festivals such as 'Id'. Made in marble, the 'jharokha' with a three-arched opening and inlaid with precious stones (this is in fact... the real attraction), was known as the 'Takht-i-Murassa' or the Throne Room. Recommended to stop by for less than 30 minutes, get some shots and move on. Included in your ticket to Agra Fort.

title: Court for public
review: This is situated within the Agra Fort and is a place where the emperor used to take decisions pertaining to local people. The guide showed us the seat where the emperor used to sit and the pillars of this hall are aligned in such a way that the emperor can view the entrance i.e. he can view each and every person coming in the hallway directly from his seat.

title: Wonderful architecture and rich history.
review: Diwan-I-Am or Hall of Public Audience was the place where the emperor addressed the public as well as the nobility. The emperor was Shah Jehan. Made in marble and inlaid with precious stones, was known as the Throne Room. This room was connected to the royal apartments and the royal ladies could watch the ceremonies of the Diwan-i-Am through the marble windows. Wonderful architecture and rich history.

title: Above expectations
review: Took a tuktuk to vist the Fort. Plenty of guides around for a cheap price if you need one. When we first saw it I was amazed at the size, I never imagined it was so big. Lovely place, well kept gardens, lots of chipmunks running around and a lovely view of the Yumuna river and  the Taj Mahal. Probably need 1 to 2 hours depending on your interest.

title: Good place to visit
review: It should take about 2 hours to complete which should be enough. But ready for a walk. You get a view of Taj from this fort should be worth for some photo session with a good SLR zoom camera. There is a light and sound show from 07:30 PM to 08:30 PM ( Hindi/Urdu version) and subsequently a show in English version. Show is a little boring. Eatables not allowed. But water bottles allowed. If you are ready to shell out 150-200 bucks, Get accompanied by a guide. There will be lot of guides chasing you at the entrance.

title: This is also part of Agra Fort
review: Part of  Agra Fort this is also called hall of public where the Mughal emperors used to address general public.

title: Again it is the part of Agra fort.
review: I don't know why Tripadvisor mentioned everything separately. It is also a part of Agra fort. Where king was addressing the common public. nothing to see specially.

title: Diwan Fort
review: As with so many other sites in India, this one is okay, but not worth going out of your way.  If you have not visited any other countries, you may be slightly impressed.  However, as with so many others, it can pale by comparison to other sites in other countries.

title: The court
review: This is public hall / court where emperors used to meet common people inside the Agra Fort. You can get guides. Need to negotiate little with them.

title: Treat to visit and rest in the scrouching heat of summers
review: Apart from the historical importance, Diwan-e-aam is truely made for aam aadmi (common people) because you can stop and rest in this shady region of agra fort and know about the history of the place in a better way.

title: An Interesting Place.
review: Probably a wrong time to go as it was very hot.  But it was included when going to see the Taj Mahal and you tend to get used to the heat as you marvel at the building and take pictures.

title: beautifully built ages ago
review: the time and effort taken to build the architectural fort is commendable. the handwork and marble used is extremely beautiful. this is an interesting spot open to the common man and it is included along the agra fort complex only. try going during winters, it was too sunny when we went

title: Historical monument
review: Just beyond Jahangir's Mahal inside the Agra Fort lies the Diwan-I-Aam or the Hall of Public Audience. It is also known as the Hall of Forty Pillars. The Mughal emperors held their daily 'Durbars' here, and the famed Peacock Theone was also placed here during Shahjahan's reign. You can visualise the emperor's court and his royal nobles in attendance. Must visit.

title: Massive, really well-maintained hall with great view of gardens
review: Coming near the end of most walking tours of the Fort, the Diwan-e-Aam's sheer size is quite overpowering. The view of the grand gardens opposite and imagining an audience in this setting is quite an experience. The acoustics of the place are quite astounding, too!

title: The tour of Agra fort almost terminates here!
review: The king used to hold the court for hearing at this place. the pillars of this veranda are in such a manner that the king could have a clear sight of the person entering into the premise from any direction.

title: Diwan-i-Am
review: Diwan I am is built by shahjahan to for use as court for common public..but today is a popular tourist distanation in agra

title: A big hall inside Agra fort.
review: Diwan-e-Aam is a big hall built inside the Agra fort. This hall was used by mughals to arrange meetings with general public of the city.

title: Hall of public audience Inside the agra fort
review: Its the place where king meet local people of his kingdom. It's mainly made using red sandstone. This place is inside the agra fort complex and close to macchi bhavan.

title: View inside!
review: Inside Jahangir's Mahal lies the Diwan-I-Aam or the Hall of Public Audience. It is also known as the Hall of Forty Pillars. The Mughal emperors held their daily 'Durbars' here, and the famed Peacock Theone was also placed here during Shahjahan's reign.

title: A must see in Agra!
review: Very beautiful place with lots of history. Wonderfully preserved with ties to the builder of the Taj Mahal. Nice views of the Taj from the upper level...

title: NICE PLACE
review: Court of King Akbar for the local people.

title: Another must see!
review: While in Agra this is a must see after the Taj Mahal. Full of history and interesting to see. Visit early to avoid the crowds!

title: Disappointing
review: I wish this was better. You pay the usual overcharge being non Indian and there are some interesting and beautiful marble architecture but there was no audioguide, vast sections were closed off though there were some info boards, there were no signs, maps or directions to different areas.

title: will be seen in Agra Fort
review: Diwan i Am in Persian means the place which all people are permitted to visit the king and report him or ask him something . totally has been constructed with white marble with too beautiful hand works . a part is which has the roof has many colums which make it more beautiful and another part which has no roof has two throne for seating the emperor and open wide area for the people who should be there  .

title: Another Marvel at the Fort !
review: Often, during our tour, I wondered how could they in the past constructed such amazing, interconnected and intricate structures. This is  part of the Fort. Just opp., is a park with benches and lawns, where we took a seat and enjoyed simply viewing everytjing around us in amazement!

title: Diwan-i-Am
review: The Diwani-I-Am is a rectangular shaped building with open arches located within the Agra Fort Complex. This was the place where the Mughal Emperors used to give audience to the general public to hear their grievances. A nice place to spend some time and click photographs in the Fort.

title: Handwork & Marble made amazing architecture.
review: In Agra Fort's Diwan-i-Am, the main thing which is observed by me is Handwork & Marble made amazing architecture. It is used like court in Mughal Empire. Whitish look with a stunning view. Column made which is given a good photo view in different angle.

title: Emporer's court
review: This was only portion for the huge Agra fort, which was accessible to common people and bring their grievance to the emperor himself and general proceeding as well. Typical mugal architecture with pillars engraved with flowers and scribing in Persian and Arabic, over looking a vast lawn.

title: History becomes alive
review: Get a good guide, typically costing 800 Rs for both Taj Mahal and Agra fort, and you can almost listen to history whispering.

title: part of fort
review: Diwan e aam and diwane khas is main part of any mughal fort.

title: Very nice place - worth a visit
review: Part of the Ref Fort, this is a very well kept, sprawling complex with well groomed gardens.  The Taj Mahal can be seen in the distance.  Intricate cravings adorn the walls of many buildings.

title: Small but historically very important
review: This is the place where Great Akbar used to interact with the local people and listen to their problems and solve them. The name literally translate to Place for the common people. It is located within the Fort enclosure.

title: For the commons but extraordinary!
review: This pavilion is supposed to be for the common courtiers and citizens to meet the emperor, but its beauty is stunning and extraordinary.

title: Fashion shoot
review: ON the day we visited Diwan - I - Am was being used as the backdrop for a fashion shoot. So not only did we learn from our guide the historic information about the building we also watched the fashion shoot.

title: Historic place
review: This is a part of Agra fort .. This is where the emperor addressed everyone from nobility to his subjects .. Has quite a history .. Well maintained .. Must visit

title: Historical Fort
review: Vast well preserved palace with much history of tjis region of India. Well worth a visit as there are interesting exhibits including the white pearl mosque.

title: Fascinating.
review: So much history, so much beauty. Like all of the 'attractions' in Agra, this is just overwhelmiing. A slow walk around all the varying parts of this fascinating building (buildings!) is so interesting. No efforet involved, just an absolute pleasure.

title: For the aam(common people)
review: It is the part of fort where king used to meet common people and hear their grievances. It is also used to solve dispute between people of the kingdom.

title: Within the Fort
review: Beautiful architecture within Agra Fort and part of the tour. Agra Fort should be part of your visit to Agra.

title: Interesting place to be
review: The interesting thing about this place is the throne location can be seen from any corner. The walls are built in such a way that no two walls would obstruct the king's view. The clever and simple civil engineering of the placement of walls, pillars and roofs made it possible that the sound was audible to everyone in the assembly.

title: Agra fort tour
review: We visited this venue with a local guide as part of our golden triangle tour. Very large fort and palace with impressive views and great photo spots. You can get a great photo of the Taj Mahal in the distance from the rear.

title: Part of Agra Fort.
review: This is another section of the Agra Fort.

title: Golden Triangle
review: Trip was just awesome they arranged everything very nicely thankyou abhishak and team. Will defnetly plan a trip again with your travels again soon.

title: fort interior
review: here the lawns are well maintained, and the diwan e aam is the place where the general public give their grevencies to the king

title: Public reception rooms at Agra Fort
review: The symetrical structure of this beautiful building would have formed the perfect interface between royalty and the public.

title: Beautiful Muslim architecture
review: The symmetry was amazing. The throne area interesting. Incredible angles everywhere. Part of the Agra red fort tour.

title: local court in ancient time
review: local court, where people comes with there problem to Shahjahan, and he used to solve there problem.. Architecture is very nice . its Like Big Hall....

title: If only it would be well preserved
review: This place is very imposing as it is, but one cannot help to wonder how incredibly beautiful and out of this world this place would have been, had it been well treated and maintained through out all this years.

title: A place where the king used to meet the general public
review: Diwan-i-Am as the name suggest is the place inside the Fort where the emperor used to meet general public on defined days. His setaing area is a little elevated and the original seat is still there at the location . It will take you to the royal era with mermerising view and the thought

title: Impressive
review: As this was included in our tour, we don;t have specific travel details to get here. Definitely worth the visit...

title: In Agra Fort
review: Located within the Agra Fort, this is a historical structure that can be seen. There's also a light-n-sound show there.

title: Symmetrical perfection
review: What a place to display your wealth and power to your subjects! This public audience pavilion must surely have impressed those seeking the wisdom or resolution of their problems by their ruler.

title: part of Agra Fort
review: Rivals the Diwan i Am in Fatehpur Sikri, though this was used by several Moghul emperors.  Diwan-i-am is an area where the emperors met their subjects and heard their concerns, dispensed justice etc.  A sort of court for the people.

title: Good place
review: The Diwan-i-Am, or Hall of Audience, located in the Red Fort of Delhi was where the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan and his successors received members of the general public and heard their grievances.

title: Nice
review: A must visit in Agra!! Do opt for winters for travelling and carry along shades, sunscreen and cap as scorching sun will definitely burn/tan your skin. In totality, its an exceptionally good monument..

title: Vox Populi, Vox Die (Voice of people is the Voice of God)
review: Almost all the Mughal forts I have visited have their own variants of Diwan-e-Am, this one being no exception. The architecture and bueaty notwithstanding, on visiting this place you will get a sense that, inspite of all their frailties and wayward ways the kings of the bygone India did listen to their subjects and did their job well. The design marvels you : Pillars and structures are positioned for maximum connect with the audience from any angle, a large courtyard. While visiting it is important to pay attention to these details. A guide helps (Rs 250 for family of five to six)

title: In Agra Fort
review: In most of the Mughal fort, there are are two places

title: A feel of Mughal Empire
review: The huge assembly hall measuring 201' by 67' has flat roof and two arched red sandstone gateways to the north and south. The façade has an arcade with nine bold arches and the hall is divided into three aisles. Though the building was constructed in red sandstone, yet it had been plastered with white shell plaster to resemble the white marble. The raised rectangular chamber from where the emperor addressed the people was ostentatiously ornamented.

title: beautiful court and the beautiful arches from the mughal period.
review: This is one of the main attraction in Agra fort.

title: Excellent
review: Excellent place for photography.. Many film shootings are done here including Jodha Akbar..  Guide not required..

title: Located within Agra Fort
review: Place of public court kind of in old times. Big open hall with a lots of artwork on the walls. A special place for the seat of the Emperor.

title: Worth seeing
review: This is part of the Red Fort. This Hall of Public Audience is interesting as this was where the Mughal king would sit and listen to the common people and resolve their issues. The adjacent lawn and garden is nice.

title: Interesting
review: Diwan-i-Am is inside the Agra fort where the kings were supposed to have carried out their meetings with the public. The ground in front had space to carry out various sports and activities. There are pillared varandas around the ground where public used to wait for their chance to spell out their grievances to the king.

title: place where king used to interact with people
review: very interesting place in course of history,the place was used by mughal kings to interact with general public, a must visit place for history lovers

title: king's seating place!
review: The place where King was sitting and taking entertainment and other meetings with its member of ruler. Queen can also sit with him in nearby rooms. Go there and take pic that will make feel you like a king and increase your excitement to stay there for more.

title: Part of Red Fort
review: Diwan-I-Am or Hall of Public Audience was the place where the emperor addressed the general public as well as the nobility.

title: Place where King interacted with his common subjects
review: It is located inside the Agra Fort and as the name suggests, this is a place where the Mughal King used to interact with his public. Structure as well as the space in front is well maintained with manicured lawns all around. It consists of pillared hall on a raised platform, it provides a good back drop for photography. The enclosure where the Royals used to sit well decorated with marble carvings and arches.

title: nice
review: my biggest mistake was that i traveled in the month of june..avoid summers....rest is superb ...excellent and very good for family

title: the commom court
review: Diwan - i - aam was the place where mughal emperor Shahjahan used to listen to the grievances of common people

title: ITS A PART OF AGRA FORT
review: its 1 agra fort part , you must visit with a guide as without guide you never know what is real reason of everything

title: The Hall of Public Audience
review: The Diwan-i-Am or Hall of Public Audience is a feature of all major Mughal palaces including the Agra Fort. The one here is a large hall where the Mughal emperor could interact with the people, who came with their requests or issues.

title: An arcaded hall within the Agra Fort exudes an air of calm
review: Diwan-i-Aam can be found in the grounds of the vast Agra fort.It's worth spending some time here and looking at the alcoves of inlaid marble which provides the setting for the Peacock Throne.

title: Perfect piece of architecture
review: History lovers will surely gonna love this place.The place is built for taking complaints for the general folks. Here in this court discussion would take place.

title: Common court
review: Diwan e Aam means common court where Mughal Kings used to recieve complains from common folks. Great architecture. Must see for those interested in history.

title: Must visit in Agra fort
review: Just after entry from one of the gate- Singh gate, you can see this. In front of the Diwane-i- Aam, it has one TOP and enter inside and just go upstair and see the most amazing structure of Agra fort

title: A standout building
review: Agra Fort is impressive, but this is one of the more impressive structures in the compound, enhanced by the huge gardens outside.

title: Beautiful Hall
review: The Dian-i-Am in Agra fort is superb architecture with fantastic arches and alcoves with beautiful inlaid work in a variety of semi precious stones. It is a huge building where the king met his subjects if they had a greavance. See the place of The Chain! Surrounded by lawn on which are birds- hoopoes galore. A quiet peacful place after the busy Taj Mahal.

title: A fine building within the fort
review: One of several beautiful structures within the Agra Fort. Very harmonious architecture. Many fine details to be admired.

title: Great...
review: It is a wonderful place to see great mugal architecture work. It is inside the agra fort.  It is well designed hall where king used to interact with the common public.

title: Agra Fort - Hall of Public Audience
review: This is one of the first parts of the Agra Fort that you get to see on your tour - and it is one of the most impressive. Great architecture with amazing detail!

title: majestic
review: Beautiful architecture, makes us proud of our heritage

title: Awesome natural gardens and architecture...
review: This is a must visit site in the Agra fort... It has historic significance apart from the nice piece of architectural marvel... highly recommended
